decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings:	P500B (Proposed Block Plan); P501A (Proposed Ground Floor Plan); P502A (Proposed First Floor Plan); P503A (Proposed Roof Plan); P506A (Proposed Front Elevation); P507A (Proposed Rear Elevation); P508A (Proposed Side Elevations).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and policies 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012). | The upper-floor side elevation windows shall be obscure-glazed and non-opening unless the parts of the windows which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the windows are installed.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of the development and nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 19).

| The 1.8m privacy screens for the raised rear deck, as identified in drawing numbers P501A (Proposed Ground Floor Plan) and P508A (Proposed Side Elevations), shall be installed prior to the occupation of the hereby approved flats and maintained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 19).
| The refuse storage identified in the approved drawings listed in condition 2 shall be installed prior to the occupation of the hereby approved flats and maintained permanently thereafter.
Reason: To ensure adequate refuse storage, in accordance with Policy SI 7 of the London Plan (2021).
| The cycle storage identified in the approved drawings listed in condition 2 shall be installed prior to the occupation of the hereby approved flats and maintained permanently thereafter.
Reason: To ensure adequate cycle storage, in accordance with Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 10dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedroom adjoining the main entrance/staircase/corridor to separate dwelling. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 19), the NPPF (2023) and SPG10 Noise and Vibration.

| The car parking space as identified in the approved drawings listed in condition 2 shall only be used by the occupiers or visitors of Flat 1 located on the ground floor for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To preserve amenity of future occupiers, in accordance with Policy D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: Conversion of existing dwellinghouse into 2 self-contained residential flats and provision of associated parking space, cycle storage and refuse storage facilities; single storey front/side extension; part single, part two storey rear extension; creation of raised rear deck; alterations to the fenestration; and replacement of windows
